FuncDef:
The link-protocol forwarding command enables an interface to forward the specific packets.
The undo link-protocol forwarding command deletes the specific packets forwarding configuration. That means that an interface is enabled to discard the specific packets again after the undo link-protocol forwarding command is run.
By default, interfaces configured discard received lacp, lamp, c-stp, s-stp, port-authentication, link-oam, eoam3ah, e-lmi and ptp-peer-delay packets.
CLIs: link-protocol forwarding { c-stp | s-stp | eoam3ah | e-lmi | ptp-peer-delay }
undo link-protocol forwarding { c-stp | s-stp | eoam3ah | e-lmi | ptp-peer-delay }

ParaDef.Info:
Configures interfaces to forward Layer 2 control protocol packets c-stp with the destination MAC address of 01-80-c2-00-00-00.
-

Configures interfaces to forward Layer 2 control protocol packets s-stp with the destination MAC address of 01-80-c2-00-00-08.
-

Configures interfaces to forward Layer 2 control protocol packets e-lmi.
-

Configures interfaces to forward Layer 2 control protocol packets ptp-peer-delay.
-

Configures interfaces to forward Layer 2 control protocol packets eoam3ah.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command enables an interface to forward the specific packets.
The protocol of lacp, lamp, c-stp, s-stp, port-authentication, e-lmi, eoam3ah cannot be run on Eth-Trunk member interfaces. A GE interface that has this command run cannot be added to an Eth-Trunk interface.
The protocol of link-oam and ptp-peer-delay cannot be configured on an Eth-Trunk interface, but can be configured on an Eth-Trunk member interface.
